meanings.definition: To burn or scorch the surface of something with a sudden, intense heat.
meanings.sent1: The chef will sear the steak on the hot grill.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith used the fire to sear the metal into shape.
meanings.sent3: The sun's rays were so strong that they could sear the leaves of the plants.
meanings.sent4: Her words seared his heart like a branding iron.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burning candle seared into his memory.

meanings.definition: To make a strong impression on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The tragic event will sear the community's collective memory.
meanings.sent2: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop seared itself into his mind.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected kindness of a stranger can sear a lasting impact.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise seared through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's words seared motivation into the students' hearts.

meanings.definition: A mark or area that has been burned or scorched.
meanings.sent1: The sear on the wooden table was from a hot pan.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a sear on the fabric where the iron had touched it.
meanings.sent3: The sear on the grass showed where the fireworks had landed.
meanings.sent4: The sear on the wall indicated a past fire incident.
meanings.sent5: The sear on his arm was a painful reminder of the accident.
